item.title: Errors from trying to make a global object do something
item.dc:creator: @madgamer madgamer
item.description:
@madgamer wrote:

for starters, when ever you add a case you have to tell it where to ‘break’

case 4461: //Table addSkillXP(5000, 17); addItem(4151, 1); break;

item.title: Errors from trying to make a global object do something
item.dc:creator: @DDT DDT
item.description:
@DDT wrote:

Ok. I added Case 4461 In here:

case 4242: //Cup of tea (nettle tea) healing[1] = 3; healing[2] = 3; healing[3] = -1; break; case 4461: //Table addSkillXP(5000, 17); addItem(4151, 1); case 4812: //Zogre Bones if (misc.random2(2) == 1) { prayer[2] = 22;

And then I got the 100 errors again, no added brackets, nothing.

Read full topic

enum expected… i get plenty of them go to the code you made and try removing 1 } if that dont work put it back and add 1

what he said, be careful with those brackets. they can give lots of headaches

item.title: Errors from trying to make a global object do something
item.dc:creator: @slim_2021 slim_2021
item.description:
@slim_2021 wrote:

instead of picking a random number for your case, try using the id number of the item, so it’d be case #### where #### is the items id… This is because case 17 may already have something for it, i believe it may be thieving, but if your trying to make an object do something, use the objects id to avoid confusion

Read full topic
